definition: can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very
to love/to be fond of/to like/affection/to be inclined (to do sth)/to tend to (happen)
to act cute/putting on adorable airs/to pretend to be lovely

sentences.english: He even calls her by a cute nickname, "Snips."
sentences.chinese: 他甚至用一個可愛的暱稱，“小鬼頭”來叫她。

sentences.english: You are the most loving and caring person any friend could ever have.
sentences.chinese: 您是夫復何求最可愛最貼心的朋友。

sentences.english: They're kinda cute when they're not quite big enough to trample you.
sentences.chinese: 當他們沒有長大到足夠攻擊你的時候，還是很可愛的。

sentences.english: He is a lovely boy but he has no family.
sentences.chinese: 他是一個可愛的男孩，但是卻失去了家人。

sentences.english: I followed this kitty all around the places, and finally got this lovely shot.
sentences.chinese: 我追著它繞來繞去，最後終於等到這張可愛的照片。

sentences.english: She is fairer than the morning star, and whiter than the moon.
sentences.chinese: 她比那晨星更可愛，比月亮更皎潔。

sentences.english: She is a scatty but charming girl.
The colours used are a selection of lovely soft greens and pinks.
sentences.chinese: 採用的顏色是一系列可愛的淡綠色和粉紅色。

sentences.english: These two kittens on this piece of double-sided embroidery look like real ones. They are really lovable.
sentences.chinese: 這幅雙面繡上的兩隻小貓維妙維肖，可愛極了。

sentences.english: Sweet Adeline: Why Was I Born?
sentences.chinese: 《可愛的艾德琳》中的“爲何生我？”

sentences.english: Who’s the cutest kitty in the world?
sentences.chinese: 誰是這個世界上最可愛的貓咪呀？

sentences.english: Jenna was always happy and bubbly, a lovely person.
sentences.chinese: 珍娜總是很高興，生氣勃勃的，是一個可愛的人。

sentences.english: There are so many adorable girl schnauzers here in the Lover Zone.
sentences.chinese: 在情人區有好多可愛的小雪妹妹。

sentences.english: Only nature wreaks such lovely havoc.
sentences.chinese: 只有自然才搞那麼可愛的破壞。

sentences.english: A thief had a son who had lovely curls.
sentences.chinese: 一個小偷有個長着可愛捲髮的兒子。

definition: to feel happy/to rejoice/to have a great time/to make fun of sb
only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)

that one/that thing/that (as opposed to this)/(used before a verb or adjective for emphasis)/(used to humorously or indirectly refer to sth embarrassing, funny etc, or when one can't think of the right word)/(used in speech as a filler, similar to "umm", "you know" etc)/(euph.) menstruation/sex/also pr. [nei4 ge5]

apex/crown of the head/top/roof/most/to carry on the head/to push to the top/to go against/to replace/to substitute/to be subjected to (an aerial bombing, hailstorm etc)/(slang) to "bump" a forum thread to raise its profile/classifier for headwear, hats, veils etc
cat/CL:隻|只[zhi1]/(dialect) to hide oneself/(coll.) modem
